== Template:ChartsCss column ==
Renders a Charts.css chart table and loads the stylesheet (via the `<chartscss>` tag).

=== Parameters ===
* `type` (optional): chart type class, e.g. `column`, `bar`, `line`, `area`
* `classes` (optional): additional Charts.css classes, e.g. `show-primary-axis show-4-secondary-axes data-spacing-4 reverse-data`
* `caption` (optional): table caption
* `xHeader`, `yHeader`: column headings
* `rows`: wikitext that expands to one or more `<tr>...</tr>` rows (typically via `Template:ChartsCss row`)

=== Example ===
<pre>
{{ChartsCss column
 | type=column
 | classes=show-primary-axis show-4-secondary-axes data-spacing-4 reverse-data
 | caption=Front End Developer Salary
 | xHeader=Year
 | yHeader=Income
 | rows=
   {{ChartsCss row | label=2016 | size=calc(40 / 100) | value=$ 40K }}
   {{ChartsCss row | label=2017 | size=calc(60 / 100) | value=$ 60K }}
   {{ChartsCss row | label=2018 | size=calc(75 / 100) | value=$ 75K }}
   {{ChartsCss row | label=2019 | size=calc(90 / 100) | value=$ 90K }}
   {{ChartsCss row | label=2020 | size=calc(100 / 100) | value=$ 100K<br/>ðŸ‘‘ }}
}}
</pre>

Notes:
* `size` is a raw CSS value for the `--size` custom property. Common forms are `0.4` or `calc(40 / 100)`.
* MediaWiki does not accept table sectioning/column elements like `<thead>`, `<tbody>`, `<tfoot>`, `<colgroup>`, and `<col>` (even when you use HTML syntax in wikitext). If you copy examples from chartscss.org that use these elements, they may be stripped or ignored. This template intentionally avoids them.
</noinclude>
